security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill. Static analyzer flagged shell command examples and hash symbols in markdown as potential security issues, but these are harmless documentation patterns. No executable code, network access, or file operations exist in this skill.

low_findings.title: Documentation Contains Shell Command Examples
low_findings.description: SKILL.md contains shell command examples in code blocks for git workflow documentation. These are documentation patterns, not executable code. Examples include git tag, git log, git diff, git commit, and git push commands shown for release workflow illustration.

content.value_statement: Managing plugin releases manually leads to forgotten changelog updates and inconsistent versioning. This skill automates the entire release workflow including version bump detection, changelog generation, and git tag creation.
actual_capabilities: Analyze git changes since last release tag
Auto-detect version bump type (patch, minor, major)
Generate changelog entries in English and Chinese
Create git commit and version tag
Preview all changes with dry-run mode
limitations: Only works within baoyu-skills repository structure
Does not push to remote repositories (manual push required)
No support for pre-release versions (reserved for future)

use_cases.title: Quick Patch Release
use_cases.description: Run the skill to automatically bump patch version, update changelogs, and create a release tag for bug fix releases.

use_cases.title: Feature Release with Changelog
use_cases.description: Prepare a minor release with properly formatted changelog entries in both English and Chinese for new features.

use_cases.title: Release Preview Before Publishing
use_cases.description: Use dry-run mode to preview exactly what will change before committing, ensuring release accuracy.

best_practices: Always run with --dry-run first to verify changes before committing
Review changelog translations for accuracy before final release
Use --major flag only when breaking changes are explicitly required
anti_patterns: Skipping the release workflow and pushing directly without version bump
Updating only one language changelog (always sync EN and CN)
Forgetting to push tags after pushing main branch

faq.question: Does this skill push to remote?
faq.answer: No. The skill creates commits and tags locally. You must run 'git push' manually after the release completes.

faq.question: How does version bump detection work?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes commit messages. Feat: prefixes trigger minor bumps, all other changes trigger patch bumps unless forced with --major or --minor.

faq.question: Can I release pre-release versions?
faq.answer: The --pre flag is reserved but not yet implemented. Currently only supports stable releases.

faq.question: What if I have breaking changes?
faq.answer: Use --major flag to force a major version bump. The skill will warn you if breaking changes are detected.

faq.question: Does this work for non-baoyu projects?
faq.answer: No. This skill is specifically designed for the baoyu-skills repository structure with its specific file locations.

faq.question: How are changelogs formatted?
faq.answer: Changelogs use Keep a Changelog format with sections for Features, Fixes, Documentation, and Other. Only sections with changes are included.
